item.title: [Allstar]Book for a pk server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:17, topic:515698”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=633955.msg4286622#msg4286622 date=1366430336]

		if (item2ID3 == 757) {
			playerMagicBook = playerMagicBook == 1 ? 0 : 1;
			c.sendMessage("You have switched your magic book.");
		}

[/quote]
I dont know how to use that “?” sing so i didn’t build the code with “?”[/quote]
Essentially, that says “If playerMagicBook == 1, switch to 0, if 0 switch to 1.”

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar]Book for a pk server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211”]Client side:

if(i == 757){ class8.aString170 = "Special-book"; class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.aStringArray189[2] = "Read"; class8.aStringArray189[3] = "Change"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Are you drunken? why are you examine this book?".getBytes(); } [/quote]
What’s the point of “wearing” a book, normally you’d “wield”.
I’d also make “change” to “switch”

[quote=“Sup22211”]Now Server side: (client.java)
add this int anywhere:

int specBook = 0;

Search for item2ID3, then you should see if statement, add this:

if(item2ID3 == 757){
if(specBook == 0){
setSidebarInterface(6, 12855);
sendMessage("You changed to ancient with this book!");
specBook = 1;
}else if(specBook == 1){
setSidebarInterface(6, 1151);
specBook = 0;
sendMessage("You changed to regular spelles with this book!");
	}
}

Now spawn book (id: 757) and check it.

Next tutorial: Maybe a book reading system?[/quote]
That part just looks nasty:

if(item2ID3 == 757 && specBook == 0){//Checks for both at once
     setSidebarInterface(6, 12855);
     specBook = 1;//I like to have everything execute before the send message.
     sendMessage("You change your spell book to Ancient Magiks!");
}else if(item2ID3 == 757 && specBook == 1){//You still want to make sure they have the book :P
     setSidebarInterface(6, 1151);
     specBook = 0;
     sendMessage("You change your spell book back to normal!");
}//Someone can't spell ;)

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar]Book for a pk server
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:1, topic:515698”]What are you adding?
a book for pkers, that book will change your spell book, you can make it cost pk points or something lol.

Client side:

if(i == 757){
class8.aString170 = "Special-book";
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
class8.aStringArray189[2] = "Read";
class8.aStringArray189[3] = "Change";
class8.aByteArray178 = "Are you drunken? why are you examine this book?".getBytes();
}

Now Server side: (client.java)
add this int anywhere:

int specBook = 0;

Search for item2ID3, then you should see if statement, add this:

if(item2ID3 == 757){
if(specBook == 0){
setSidebarInterface(6, 12855);
sendMessage("You changed to ancient with this book!");
specBook = 1;
}else if(specBook == 1){
setSidebarInterface(6, 1151);
specBook = 0;
sendMessage("You changed to regular spelles with this book!");
	}
}

Now spawn book (id: 757) and check it.

Next tutorial: Maybe a book reading system?[/quote]
lol this is a snippet…
however class8.aByteArray178 = "Are you drunken? why are you examine this book?".getBytes();
it’s spelled wrong.

And do you think i can change this for any item?

if(i == 757){ class8.aString170 = "Special-book"; class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.aStringArray189[2] = "Read"; class8.aStringArray189[3] = "Change"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Are you drunken? why are you examine this book?".getBytes(); }

Read full topic

item.title: [Allstar]Book for a pk server
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

What are you adding?
a book for pkers, that book will change your spell book, you can make it cost pk points or something lol.

Client side:

if(i == 757){
class8.aString170 = "Special-book";
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
class8.aStringArray189[2] = "Read";
class8.aStringArray189[3] = "Change";
class8.aByteArray178 = "Are you drunken? why are you examine this book?".getBytes();
}

Now Server side: (client.java)
add this int anywhere:

int specBook = 0;

Search for item2ID3, then you should see if statement, add this:

if(item2ID3 == 757){
if(specBook == 0){
setSidebarInterface(6, 12855);
sendMessage("You changed to ancient with this book!");
specBook = 1;
}else if(specBook == 1){
setSidebarInterface(6, 1151);
specBook = 0;
sendMessage("You changed to regular spelles with this book!");
	}
}

Now spawn book (id: 757) and check it.

Next tutorial: Maybe a book reading system?

Read full topic
